intro: Galium borysthenicum, commonly known as the Borysthenian bedstraw, is a perennial herb native to parts of Eastern Europe and Central Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, white to pale pink flowers during the summer months. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream sides. Its flowers are typically visited by various pollinators, including bees and flies.
